title: Introduction to klassR
text: Norwegian data set codes Standard Industrial Classification want find mean? data Norwegian municipality numbers names? perhaps want convert English standard occupations Ny Norsk figure. tasks R package klassR can help . Statistics Norway’s KLASS central database classifications code lists. API makes easy fetch standards different computing environments. klassR provides easy interface fetch apply R. Statistic Norway employees, package installed platforms. others, can installed CRAN : CRAN R’s central repository thousands useful packages. information requirements klassR can found CRAN use function klassR package must called time new R session started. can done using:

title: Introduction to klassR
text: fetch classification KLASS need unique classification number. can found URL KLASS website can search R using one following functions.

title: Introduction to klassR
text: function ListKlass fetch list classifications. returns classification name (klass_name), number (klass_nr) classification family belongs (klass_family). classification type (klass_type) also shown indicates whether classification code list. Code lists classifications used national internal (Statistics Norway) publications. can included list using codelist parameter

what: Search for a classification using a keyword
title: Introduction to klassR
text: can also search classification keyword using SearchKlass function. first parameter query search . , include code lists search specified Sometimes classification code list appear several times. due occurs several times different langauges database.

title: Introduction to klassR
text: fetch complete classification, use GetKlass function together unique identifier. example, fetch Standard Industrial Classifications (KLASS number 6) run:

title: Introduction to klassR
text: Classifications often organised heirachical way. example , Standard Industrial Classifications different values level. fetch specific level, use output_level parameter. example, fetch top level Standard Industrial Classification codes use:

title: Introduction to klassR
text: examples seen names returned Norwegian (Bokmål). However, many classification KLASS multiple languages. output language can specified Bokmål (“nb”), Nynorsk (“nn”) English (“en”) using language parameter. Note: 3 languages available classifcations.

title: Introduction to klassR
text: standard output style ‘long’ levels classifications listed . alternative format can chosen using parameter output_style='wide'. give one row per detailed classification codes names higher/broader levels given variables.

title: Introduction to klassR
text: classifications additional notes can fetched classification. can included data using option notes = T.

title: Introduction to klassR
text: data set want apply classification variable possible ApplyKlass. can used get name variable code form example. built test data set klassR called klassdata. contains fictitious persons sex, education level, municipality numbers, industry classification workplace occupation. can use ApplyKlass create variable municipality names (classification number 131) persons based codes. specify vector codes first parameter followed unique classification number. , language output_level can specified.
code: data(klassdata) head(klassdata) klassdata$kommune_names <- ApplyKlass(klassdata$kommune,                                        klass = 131) head(klassdata)

title: Introduction to klassR
text: Classifications often change time. KLASS database considers older classifications can fetched using date parameter.

title: Introduction to klassR
text: Fetching using classification specific time point can done using date parameter specifying date version classification applies. date format form “yyyy-mm-dd”, example “2022-05-27” 27th May, 2022. many changes regions Norway (classification number 106) past years. can see fetching classifications different times

title: Introduction to klassR
text: Sometime may useful fetch codes period time. can specifing two dates vector date paramter. following code fetched Norwegian regional codes 1st January 2019 1st January 2020. 26 different codes show old newer names.

title: Introduction to klassR
text: fetch changes time period rather codes can specify correspond=TRUE allong time interval interested . table returned correspondents codes /names time interval specified. sourceCode sourceName refer original name coding. targetCode targetName refer newer code name. Notice simple 1:1 correspondence regions. municipality number needed map changes accurately.

title: Introduction to klassR
text: Classification valid future also included KLASS. can fetched specifying future date. message shown indicate future classification. additional parameters need specified.

title: Introduction to klassR
text: addition small changes time, classifications change completely correspondence table defined within KLASS database. can fetched applied using GetKlass ApplyKlass functions together correspond parameter give unique classification number convert . fetch correspondence table municipality codes (131) greater regional codes (106) can run: can apply correspondence municipality region example data set using ApplyKlass.
code: GetKlass(131, correspond = 106, date = "2020-01-01") klassdata$region <- ApplyKlass(klassdata$kommune,                                 klass = 131,                                correspond = 106,                                date = "2016-01-01") klassdata

title: Introduction to klassR
text: also possible fetch variant classification. need provide classification number variant number.

title: Authors and Citation
text: Susie Jentoft. Maintainer.

title: Authors and Citation
text: Jentoft S, Li L, Iancu D (2023). klassR: Classifications Codelists Statistics Norway. R package version 0.2.0.
code: @Manual{,   title = {klassR: Classifications and Codelists for Statistics Norway},   author = {Susie Jentoft and Lisa Li and Diana-Cristina Iancu},   year = {2023},   note = {R package version 0.2.0}, }

title: Classifications and Codelists for Statistics Norway
text: repository repo R-package klassR. package designed provide easy interface retrieving classifications Statistic Norway’s classification database.

title: Classifications and Codelists for Statistics Norway
text: install klassR package use can load package environment fetch classification, use GetKlass function together klass number SSBs KLASS. example occupation classifications (klass number 7) can fetched depth introduction klassR can found : https://statisticsnorway.github.io/klassR/articles/klassR-vignette.html

what: Match and convert a classification — ApplyKlass
title: Match and convert a classification — ApplyKlass
text: Match convert classification

title: Match and convert a classification — ApplyKlass
code: ApplyKlass(   x,   klass,   date = NULL,   variant = NULL,   correspond = NULL,   language = "nb",   output_level = NULL,   output = "name",   format = TRUE )

title: Match and convert a classification — ApplyKlass
text: x Input vector klass Classification number date Date classification (format = "YYYY-mm-dd"). Default current date variant classification variant fetch (variant wanted). correspond ID number target correspondence table. correspondence two dates within classification, use correspond = TRUE. language Default "nb" Norwegian (Bokmål). Also "nn" (Nynorsk) "en" (English available classifications) output_level Desired output level output String describing output. May "name" (default), "code" "". format Logical whther run formatting av input vector x (Default = TRUE), important check formatting one level.

title: Match and convert a classification — ApplyKlass
text: vector data frame returned names /code desired output level.

title: Match and convert a classification — ApplyKlass
code: data(klassdata) kommune_names <- ApplyKlass(x = klassdata$kommune, klass = 131, language = "en", format=FALSE)

title:
Fetch classification data
Fetch Statistics Norway classification data using API — GetKlass
text: Fetch classification data Fetch Statistics Norway classification data using API

title:
Fetch classification data
Fetch Statistics Norway classification data using API — GetKlass
code: GetKlass(   klass,   date = NULL,   correspond = NULL,   variant = NULL,   output_level = NULL,   language = "nb",   output_style = "normal",   notes = FALSE )

title:
Fetch classification data
Fetch Statistics Norway classification data using API — GetKlass
text: klass Number/string classification ID/number. (use Klass_list() find ) date String required date classification. Format must "yyyy-mm-dd". inverval, provide two dates vector. blank, default today's date. correspond Number/string target correspondence (correspondence table requested). variant classification variant fetch (variant wanted). output_level Number/string specifying requested hierarchy level (optional). language Two letter string requested language output. Default Bokmål ("nb"). Nynorsk ("nn") English ("en") also available classification.) output_style String variable output type. Default "normal". Specify "wide" wide formatted table output. notes Logical notes returned column

title:
Fetch classification data
Fetch Statistics Norway classification data using API — GetKlass
text: function returns data frame specified classification/correspondence table. Output variables include: code, parentCode, level, name standard lists. correspondence tables variables include: sourceCode, sourceName, targetCode targetName. time correspondence tables variables include: oldCode, oldName, newCode newName. "wide" output, code name level suffixes specified.

title:
Fetch classification data
Fetch Statistics Norway classification data using API — GetKlass
code: # Get classification for occupation classifications head(GetKlass(klass = "7")) #>   code parentCode level                                        name #> 1    0       <NA>     1                  Militære yrker og uoppgitt #> 2   00          0     2 Uoppgitt / yrker som ikke kan identifiseres #> 3  000         00     3 Uoppgitt / yrker som ikke kan identifiseres #> 4 0000        000     4 Uoppgitt / yrker som ikke kan identifiseres #> 5   01          0     2         Offiserer fra fenrik og høyere grad #> 6  011         01     3         Offiserer fra fenrik og høyere grad # Get classification for occupation classifications in English head(GetKlass(klass = "7", language = "en")) #>   code parentCode level                                      name #> 1    0       <NA>     1              Armed forces and unspecified #> 2   00          0     2 Unspecified or unidentifiable occupations #> 3  000         00     3 Unspecified or unidentifiable occupations #> 4 0000        000     4 Unspecified or unidentifiable occupations #> 5   01          0     2        Commissioned armed forces officers #> 6  011         01     3        Commissioned armed forces officers

title: Testdata for klassR package — klassdata
text: dataset containing variables testing Statistics Norways classification API klassR package. observations missing incorrect testing demonstrations.

title: Testdata for klassR package — klassdata
Testdata for klassR package — klassdata
text: data frame containing 100 rows 7 variables: ID Identification number sex 1/2 variable sex education 4-digit number education standard ISCED97 (level subject area) NUS (klass = 66) 2015.01.01 kommune 4-digit code Norwegian municipality (klass = 131). Based 2015.01.01 kommune2 Numeric variable Norwegian municipality dropped leading zero's testing (klass = 131). Based 2015.01.01 nace5 5-digit code industry (NACE). Based 01.01.2015 standard industry codes (klass = 7) occupation 4-digit occupation codes using standard STYRK-08 (klass = 7) 2015.01.01
